title: 'Incredible' Sam Smith's joy: Writing's On The Wall is first Bond song EVER to hit No.1
text:
'Incredible' Sam Smith's joy: Writing's On The Wall is first Bond song EVER to hit No.1 'Incredible' Sam Smith's joy: Writing's On The Wall is first Bond song EVER to hit No.1 SAM SMITH's SPECTRE theme tune Writing's On The Wall becomes the first James Bond theme to ever hit No.1 as he announces extended version of his debut album In The Lonely Hour: The Drowning Shadows Edition. PUBLISHED: 15:13, Fri, Oct 2, 2015 | UPDATED: 15:22, Fri, Oct 2, 2015 PH Sam Smith is the first artist to top the charts with a James Bond theme 
Sam Smith is celebrating after becoming the first artist ever to score a No.1 hit with a Bond song. 
Writing's On The Wall had already topped the iTunes charts, but the single was revealed as the official UK No.1 today. 
'This is a special moment I’ll never forget,” says Sam. Related articles One-Hit Wonder Day: Our Top 13 (unlucky for some) tunes 
“It was such an honour to be asked to write and record Writing’s On The Wall and it’s incredible that it’s become the first Number 1 Bond theme song," Sam adds. 
"It’s been an unforgettable experience working with Barbara [Broccoli] and Sam [Mendes] to become part of this British legacy. 
"I couldn’t have done this without my fans." 
Sam also had more good news with the revelation of a new upcoming album release. 
SCROLL DOWN FOR THE LATEST ON SAM'S NEW ALBUM 
Sam Smith's Bond tune shot straight in at the top of the charts. 
The single sold a whopping 70,000 copies, 13,000 more than his closest competitor, Justin Bieber with What Do You Mean? 
In more than 50 years of iconic James Bond thems, no song has ever topped the charts, not even Adele's mighty Skyfall. 
Adele had to be content with a No.2 spot back in 2012 and only Duran Duran's 1985 hit View To A Kill had matched that – until today. SG Daniel Craig filming Spectre on a rooftop in Mexico City SG Daniel Craig looking as cheery as ever in Spectre 
It could have been very different though. 
While we wait patiently for Adele's new album 25 to arrive in November , the star hit headlines again recently with reports that she turned down a whopping £5million to record the them song for SPECTRE. 
"Adele was James Bond himself's first choice," an insider told the Daily Star. 
"Daniel Craig was really keen and [director] Sam Mendes was 50/50 over whether to use her or a fresh voice. Filmmakers were prepared to offer millions but Adele was never up for it. 
"How do you top a worldwide hit like Skyfall anyway? It was too big a risk." Just found out that Writing's On the Wall is No.1, thank you so much Sam Smith 
Adele's loss was Sam's gain. 
And he looks likely to be spending more time at the top of the charts soon with an exciting new album release. 
Sam's debut album In the Lonely Hour broke records and swept up awards after its release in May 2014. 
Riding high on his Bond success, the British superstar has revealed that he has been working on an extended version of the album with new collaborations and a brand new song. 
In the Lonely Hour: The Drowning Shadows Edition will be released in November and features the new song, Drowning Shadows. 
The ballad has been co-written by Sam and Fraser T Smith. 
The re-released album's bonus disc is full of acoustic and live versions of Sam's hits with stars like Mary J Blige and Disclosure. 
There are also covers of Amy Winehouse's Love Is a Losing Game and Whitney Houston's How Will I Know? 
Sam Smith's In the Lonely Hour: The Drowning Shadows Edition will be released on November 6. Related articles
